N3.Grammar:
Grammar Points  
▸ 始める - To clearly state the beginning of something that takes time. 
・彼はピアノを弾き始めた。 
・ 日本語を習い始めたのは半年前です。 
・ He started playing the piano. 
・ I started learning Japanese six months ago.  

▸ 終わる - To clearly state the end of something. 
・昨日は本を読み終わった。 
・作文を書き終わった人は出してください。 
・I finished the book yesterday. 
・If you have finished writing your essay, please send it out. 

▸ ように言う - To tell about a command, prohibition, direction or advice. 
・先生は生徒に静かにするように言った。 
・仲間にそこまで降りてきて準備をするように言うんだ。 
・The teacher told the students to be quiet. 
・Tell your people to get down there and get ready. 

▸ ように言われる - To tell about a command, prohibition, direction or advice in passive or receptive way. 
・医者にお酒を飲まないように言われました。 
・先生に宿題をしっかりやるように言われました。 
・The doctor told me not to drink alcohol. 
・I was told by the teacher to do my homework properly. 

▸ ということ - Often used to describe, clarify or emphasize the meaning or implication of something.  
・Used to express a logical conclusion or deduction based on some or third party information. 
・お客様に認められるということは最高の承認です。 
・彼はまだ来ていない ということは 電車が遅れたのだろう。 
・Being recognized by our customers is the highest approval. 
・He hasn’t arrived yet, so that means the train was delayed. 

▸ なさそうだ - When you guess something is not or think base on some observation or feeling. 
・Used to express a negative state based on visual evidence or hearsay. 
・とりあえずウィルスとは関係なさそうだから。 
・このケーキには卵が入っていなさそうだ。この 
・At any rate, it doesn't seem to have anything to do with viruses. 
・It seems that there are no eggs in this cake. 

▸ そうもない・そうにない・そうにもない - Unlikely to. Show no signs of. 
・Express that something is very unlikely to happen or show no signs of happening based on the judgment of the situation. 
・彼らは結婚しそうもない。 
・彼が一番やってきそうにない。 
・まだ実現しそうもないけど。 
・今日はお前の計画通りには行きそうにもないな。 
・They are unlikely to marry. 
・He is the most unlikely to come. 
・Not likely to happen yet, though. 
・I don't think today is going to go according to your plan.

N2.Grammar:
Grammar Points  
▸ につき - To state a reason. Means because of or on account of. 
・Indicate the reason or cause of something usually in written or formal notifications. Due to. Because of. 
・Indicate the ratio or proportion of something usually in terms of time, money or quantity. Per. Each. 
・会場内は禁煙につき、おたばこはご遠慮ください。 
・昼休みにつき、事務所は２時まで休みです。 
・この商品は期間限定につき、お早めにお買い求めください。 
・この電車は特急につき、切符の料金が高いです。 
・このホテルは一泊につき、朝食と夕食が付いています。 
・このクラスは生徒５人につき、教科書が一冊必要です。 
・Please refrain from smoking in the venue. 
・Due to the lunch break, the office will be closed until 2 o’clock1. 
・This product is for a limited time only, so please purchase it as soon as possible. 
・This train is an express, so the ticket price is high. 
・This hotel includes breakfast and dinner per night. 
・This class requires one textbook for every five students. 

▸ を問わず - Used in an announcement, written introduction and like to say anytime, anywhere, anyone, regardless of, irrespective of or without distinction. 
・Indicate that something is true or valid for any case or condition, without making any distinction or exception. 
・祭りは時期を問わずさまざまなものが行われる。 
・年齢を問わずこの映画は人気がある。 
・性別を問わず誰でも応募できます。 
・Various festivals are held at different times of the year. 
・This movie is popular regardless of age. 
・Anyone can apply regardless of gender.  

・を問わず implies that the speaker does not care about or does not consider the noun as a factor or a problem. 
・にかかわらず implies that the speaker acknowledges the noun as a factor or a problem. 

・値段にかかわらず、新しいiPhoneが発売したら買うつもりだ。 
・I intend to buy the new iPhone when it comes out, no matter what the price is.  
・The speaker knows that the price might be high or low, but still wants to buy it. 
・値段を問わず、新しいiPhoneが発売したら買うつもりだ。 
・I intend to buy the new iPhone when it comes out, regardless of the price.  
・The speaker does not care about or does not pay attention to the price at all.  

▸ に限る・に限り - Used in an announcement to mean only or just. Pose some limit, boundary or scope. 
・に限る Express the speaker’s preference or recommendation for something, based on their judgment or experience. Is best. Nothing is better than. 
・に限り Indicate a restriction or a condition for something, usually in written or formal notices. Only. Limited to. 
・冬は温泉に限る。 
・この本は初心者に限る。
・本日に限り、全品半額です。 
・このチケットは当日に限り有効です。 
・次の条件を満たす場合に限り、ディスクドライブを再構築できます。 
・Winter is best spent in a hot spring. 
・This book is best for beginners. 
・Today only, everything is half price. 
・This ticket is valid only on the day of purchase. 
・A disk drive can be rebuilt only if the following conditions are met.

N3.Grammar:
Grammar Points  
1. と - Express a condition or situation that happens naturally. May take notice at the last moment. 
・ 待ち合わせの場所につくと、友達はもう来ていた。 
・ When I arrived at the meeting place, my friends had already arrived. 

2. たら - Express a condition or situation that happens naturally or could be a hypothetic condition. Occurs once. 
・状況が変わったら知らせてください。 
・Let me know if the situation changes. 

3. ほど - Describe the unusual condition or degree of.. by using it as an example. Maximum extent. 
・その物質は水に浮かぶほど軽い。 
・The substance is so light that it floats on water. 

4. ていく - Describes sequential or simultaneous actions.  
・Describes directional movement of going away and directional changes from here to keep or continue to. 
・ゆっくり色彩は落ち着いていくはず。 
・Slowly the colors should settle down. 

5. てくる - Describes sequential or simultaneous actions. 
・Describes directional movement of coming in and directional changes until now to keep or continue to. 
・ちょっと切符を買ってくる。 
・I'm going to go buy some tickets. 

6. て続ける - Express an action that happens continuously. 
・To emphasize repetition of a habit or a custom. 
・でもこの調子でチームとして続けることができれば。 
・But if we can continue like this as a team. 

7. なら - Express a condition, situation or case to set limits, provide advice, make suggestions or invitations. 
・訪れるなら早朝がオススメです。 
・Early morning is the best time to visit.

▸ に応じ・に応じて・に応じた - Depends on some conditions such as desire, change, location, age, ability, etc. 
・Indicate that something varies or changes based on another factor or condition. 
・状況に応じて操作を検証します。 
・用途やお好みに応じ、両サービスともお使い頂けます。 
・ユーザの権限に応じたカスタムグラフへのアクセスを改善しました。 
・学生のレベルに応じ、教材を選びます。 
・季節に応じて服装を変える。 
・運動量に応じた食事をする。 
・Validate the operation according to the situation. 
・Both services are available, depending on your needs and preferences. 
・Improved access to custom graphs based on user permissions. 
・We choose the teaching materials depending on the students’ level. 
・I change my clothes according to the season. 
・I eat meals that suit my amount of exercise.  

・に応じ, に応じて, and に応じた imply a response or a suitability to another factor or condition.  
・They are used to indicate that something varies or changes based on another thing. 
・によって implies a cause, method or standard of something.  
・It is used to indicate the reason, means or criterion of something.  
・It is more general and does not imply a response or a suitability. 
・に合わせて implies a deliberate action or a choice to fit another thing.  
・It is used to indicate that something is changed or modified to match or suit another thing.  
・It does not imply a variation or a change based on another thing. 
・に従って implies a sequential or proportional relationship between two things.  
・It is used to indicate that something changes or progresses along with another thing.  
・It does not imply a response or a suitability.  

・天気によって、予定を変えるかもしれません。
・I might change my plans depending on the weather.  
・The weather is the cause of the possible change. 
・調査はインターネットによって行われた。 
・The survey was conducted by means of the internet.  
・The internet is the method of the survey. 
・成績によって、奨学金がもらえるかどうか決まる。
・Whether you can get a scholarship or not depends on your grades.  
・The grades are the standard of the scholarship.  

・相手のペースに合わせて話す。 
・I talk to match the other person’s pace.  
・I change my way of talking to fit the other person. 
・季節に合わせて髪型を変える。 
・I change my hairstyle to suit the season.  
・I choose my hairstyle based on the season. 
・状況に合わせて対応する。 
・I respond to adjust to the situation.  
・I modify my response to fit the situation.  

・時間が経つに従って、彼の気持ちが変わった。
・As time passed, his feelings changed.  
・His feelings changed along with time. 
・規則に従って行動しなさい。 
・Act in accordance with the rules.  
・Your actions should follow the rules. 
・需要が増えるに従って、価格も上がる。 
・As demand increases, prices also rise.  
・Prices rise proportionally to demand.

N2.Grammar:
Grammar Points  
▸ 以来 - Means since or ever since from the beginning. 
・Express what has happened from a certain time or event until the present. 
・入院を経験して以来、健康には気をつけるようにしています。 
・これは独立以来初めての上方成長であった。 
・日本に来た以来、日本語を勉強している。 
・Since experiencing hospitalization, I have tried to take care of my health. 
・This was the first upward growth since independence. 
・I have been studying Japanese since I came to Japan.  

・以来 with the て - form of a verb to emphasize the starting point of the time period. 
・ 車を買って以来、電車に乗らなくなった。 
・結婚して以来、幸せな日々を送っている。 
・I stopped taking the train since I bought a car. 
・I have been living happily ever since I got married.  

▸ をはじめ - Means starting with, as the beginning or including and many others. Is a representative example. 
・ Introduce an example or a representative item from a group of similar things.  
・ 子供をはじめ、誰でも参加可能です。 
・プログラム運転をはじめ高精度な各種機能を標準装備。 
・日本には英語 をはじめ 、フランス語、ドイツ語などから来た外来語がたくさんある。 
・会議には中国 をはじめ 、アジアの国々が参加した。  
・Everyone is welcome to participate, including children. 
・Various high-precision functions, including programmed operation, are standard. 
・In Japan, there are many loanwords from languages such as English, French, German, and so on. 
・China and other Asian countries participated in the conference.

▸ のもと - When something is under some certain condition, situation, influence or someone. 
・たぶんこの条件のもとで生きたくない。 
・現在の税制度のもとでは正直にやっていると割に合わない。 
・影響のもとに置くことはできない。 
・各自の責任と判断のもとにご利用下さい。 
・Probably don't want to live under these conditions. 
・Under the current tax system, it is not worth it to be honest. 
・It cannot be placed under the influence. 
・Please use at your own risk and discretion.  

のもとで : This means under or with. 
・Is used to indicate the influence, guidance or environment of something or someone.
・厳しい先輩のもとで、このスポーツの基礎を身につけた。 
・星空のもとで、デートをした。 
・I learned the basics of this sport under a strict senior. 
・I had a date under the starry sky.  

のもとに: This means under or at. 
・Is used to indicate the location or destination of something or someone.
・彼は木のもとに座って本を読んでいる。 
・この荷物はあなたのもとに届けられます。 
・He is sitting under a tree and reading a book. 
・This package will be delivered to you.  

の名のもとに: This means in the name of or under the pretext of. 
・Is used to indicate the reason or justification for something. 
・平和の名のもとに戦争をするのは矛盾している。 
・愛の名のもとに彼女を束縛するのは間違っている。 
・It is contradictory to wage war in the name of peace.
・It is wrong to restrain her under the pretext of love.  

▸ はもとより - When you explain something that is obvious or not that only but something more. 
・It is used to introduce an example or a representative item from a group of similar things  
・Emphasize that there are other items in the group that are more important or obvious. 
・製品は国内販売はもとより、海外80ヶ国に輸出。 
・北海道内外はもとより、香港や台湾といった海外からの観光客も多いです。 
・彼はスポーツ はもとより 勉強も得意だ。 
・彼女 はもとより 美人だった。 
・Products are sold domestically and exported to 80 foreign countries. 
・Many tourists come not only from inside and outside Hokkaido, but also from overseas, such as Hong Kong and Taiwan. 
・He is good at not only sports but also studying. 
・She was beautiful from the beginning.

が原因で→(−)の結果、非難-Blame is the result of →(-) Due to.  
Used to indicate the cause or reason for something, usually a negative or undesirable outcome. 
せいで is used to mark the causal connection between the cause and the result. 
せいに is another way to mark the causal connection. 
せいか is used to express uncertainty or doubt about the cause or reason.

2 〜 とおり・どおり 
それと同様に-Similarly. In the same way.  
Used to indicate that something is similar or identical to something else, usually a previous statement, instruction or expectation. 
とおり is used after verbs in dictionary form or casual past form.  
どおり is used after nouns or verbs in the continuative form. 
動詞の【辞書形・タ形】(とおり)/名詞(どおり/のとおり)

1 He acted as he said. 
2 I assembled it according to the manual. 
3 I departed as planned. 
4 As you can see, this cake is delicious. 
5 I replied as I promised.  
6 Act according to the rules.  

とおり and どおり are mostly used to express a positive or neutral result. 
But they can also be used to express a negative or unexpected result.  
However, to emphasize a negative or undesirable result. 
It is better to use せい or ため instead.  
せい and ため are nouns that mean cause or reason but they have different nuances.  
せい implies blaming or criticizing something or someone for the result. 
ため implies regretting or lamenting the result.
・彼のせいで遅刻した。[I was late because of him.]
・彼のために遅刻した。[I was late for his sake.]
・雨のせいで試合が中止になった。[The game was canceled because of the rain.]
・雨のために試合が中止になった。[The game was canceled due to the rain.]

5. 泉質のせいか、岩肌や湯船の底が滑ります。 
・せいか-State a reason for a bad result but not sure of it. 

6. 日本語が上手で、おしゃべりが好きな彼のことだから、きっと日本人の友達も多いはずだ。 
・のことだから-Because of that it will be most likely that

Grammar Points 
1. 本日の株価は下がり気味です。 
・気味-Current situation is seems somewhat or seems to be a little like. 

2. 誰も巻き込んでなんかいないわ。 
・お前は希望を与えてなんかいない。 
・なんかいない-Emphasize that something is not true. 

3. この状況はとても喜んでなんかいられない。 
・ここで待ってなんかいられない。 
・なんかいられない-Emphasize that something is not true. Potential form. 

4. 僕は家族さえ守れない。 
・それは赤ちゃんさえお菓子が好きだから。 
・さえ-Emphasize something by giving extreme example. Means even. 

5. この川は泳げるくらい深い。 
・昨日の地震は座っていられないくらい強く揺れた。 
・くらい-When you say the situation is not normal. Means at the very least or at the minimum extent. 

6. 浴室を散らかしっぱなしにしないで。 
・明かりをつけっぱなしにしたままで寝てはいけない。 
・っぱなし-Expresses leaving something on. Talk about continuous action. Have emotional connotation. 

7. この本は間違いだらけだ。 
・新しい税法は抜け穴だらけです。 
・だらけ-Means full of, riddled with or covered all over with. 

8. 美術専攻の学生に演技をさせたりして舞台を完成させる。 
・暗闇で走り回ったりしてはいけない。 
・たりして-When you say that another person’s appearance is different from normal or when you gently give an instruction. 

9. 桜が咲いて春らしい季節になります。 
・イベント会場として地元らしいスタイルの施設を提案します。 
・政治家らしくなってきた。 
・らしい-When a characteristic of something is very visible. Means seeming, appearing, -ish, like a, typical of.

Grammar Points 
1. ジェット機の低空飛行かと思った。 
・最初は冗談かと思ったよ。 
・かと思った-Misread, misunderstood, misinterpreted or miscalculated probable thought. 

2. 建物とか食べ物とか全然違うんで。 
・たとえば、作戦とか場所とかそんなの。 
・まさに普通とか平凡を意味します。 
・とか-Give some examples. 

3. 買い物のついでにでもお寄りください。 
・君が飲むついでに、僕の分も入れてくれないかな。 
・観光ついでに魚市場を覗いてみるのもおすすめ。 
・ついでに-Take advantage of another action to do something erase. Means incidentally, taking the opportunity, while one is at it. 

4. それで環境に良いに違いない。 
・田舎はたいへん美しいに違いない。 
・に違いない-When you are absolutely sure. Without doubt.  

5. 他の何物かであるに相違ない。 
・そこに含まれるすべての情報が事実に相違ないことを申請者が証明したとみなされます。 
・に相違ない-When you are absolutely sure. Without doubt.  

6. アクセス制限ぬきでは、データは乱用されたり内密に変更されたりします。 
・つまり、実際の金銭的損失の危険ぬきで、株式取引の多くを学ぶことができます。 
・ぬきで-Means without. 

7. 抱き合ってしょうがない。 
・さくらの衣装を作りたくてしょうがない。 
・今日は一日中眠くてしょうがない。 
・てしょうがない-Means can’t resist doing, can’t helped but do, unavoidable to do or inevitable. 

8. 楽しくて仕方がないはずです。 
・覗きたくて仕方がない。 
・スマートフォンの中身が気になって仕方がないという方が多いのです。 
・て仕方がない-Means can’t resist doing, can’t helped but do, unavoidable to do or inevitable. 

9. うれしくてたまらないのだ。 
・その通りのことが起きたことがうれしくてたまらない様子。 
・暑くてたまらない。 
・てたまらない-Means can’t resist doing, can’t helped but do, intolerable to do or unbearable.
